name: Lumino City
description: Lumino City is an award-winning hand-made Puzzle Adventure game. By exploring the city, and using your ingenuity piece together all sorts of puzzling mechanisms to help the people who live in its unique world. Discover gardens in the sky, towers marooned high on an immense waterwheel, and houses dug precariously into cliffs.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Processor: 2 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM

reviews.review_text: Brilliant work. Never wanted it to end. It's a delight to explore the hand-crafted world and solve smart puzzles along the way. Colours, music, concept, anything this game offers makes you feel simply happy.

Lumino City is absolutely amazing, I really admire the creative work behind this, all the environments were hand made with physical models. The aesthetics of the game is breathtaking, plus the clever camera angles, the brilliant soundtrack and the entertaining puzzles makes this game a gem!!! Well done State of Play! I'm on my 3rd hour and enjoying a lot. It runs smoothly on my Macbook with no heating and great performance.

This game is very atmospheric and charming. The art style is amazing and the audio/music is too. The puzzles are (sometimes convoluted but mostly) decent and have a very tactile feeling to them.  However it is frustrating to have to fight to get the game to do what I wanted it to. Expect input lag. Expect to misclick and have to wait upwards of 15 seconds to be able to do anything. Expect glichy areas where it takes upwards of 40 clicks just to get her to open the damned drawer. It took me forever to figure out why sometimes I couldn't open up my inventory. It's always hard to tell where exactly to click to get something done, making navigation difficult. At one point during the victory animation of a puzzle I clicked the back button to go progress in the game, but I apparently backed out too quickly and had to DO THE PUZZLE OVER. A brilliant game but you really have to fight with it.  Other complaints include the fact that all of their generated graphics (characters, speech bubbles(?)) are noticibly uglier than the rest of the game. There are also a few graphical errors (teleporting birds, boats rocking on a loop that isn't quite complete and then jerking back to the start of the animation loop). Another thing is that they say it should take about 10 hours to complete, but I'd say this number should be closer to 5. It took me just over 5 hours and that included the time it took for me to search around online to try to find a way to progress (it turned out that I just had to keep clicking the same spot over and over until the game finally decided that I had clicked the hitbox I needed to click).   Other than the frustration that comes with every minute of playing this game, it is a nice game and it does have interesting puzzle mechanics and a nice atmosphere. Wouldn't really recommend for the price.

可能除去画面，这款游戏就几乎没有什么亮点了吧。但只是  画面  就足以让这款游戏令人难忘。 Except the graphics, I do not think there's something worth noticing.  But it is the   Amazing graphics  that defines this game, and that's absolutely enough.
I picked this up through a Humble Bundle. Very interesting animation. Worth playing for sure.

This is not just the same Point & Click game, yes it is that but the graphics are so.... well technically you cannot call them graphics because they are captures of real things.  The story is great, not too long but great fun to play, Loved it...
Creative , amazing puzzle game. Test your skills with Lumino City!

Lumino City is a beautifully made game. The puzzles are fun; not too hard nor too easy. having said that, i found the game a little too short (finished it in 6 hours) and the story line poorly written. it really is a game to play to relax after a long day at work (and the soundtrack really helps with this!). the mobile version price is more bang for your buck, but honestly speaking, seeing the art on a larger screen was quite mesmerizing.

Wow!  Piece of art!  @ devs: Thank you!  @ steamers: no collection gets an AAA rating without that game in the library   __________________________  Lumino City is one of the most beautiful gaming experiences I´ve had in the last decades. You can really feel that it´s been made by people who love their job. If you want to... hmmmm... if you like.... .... the game is ....... ****!!! I will not even try to explain it: you have to experience this game on your own!

Lumino city is a puzzle game which is centered around a little girl 'Lumi' whose grandfather kidnapped    by contract company    .Then Lumi start to find her granddad by exploring whole city and fixing problems (puzzles)... The most amazing thing is environment in lumino city is fully handmade. The only negative about this game is its hard to find clickable objects in game. Graphics: 10/10 Gameplay: 9/10  Music: 8/10  PS: Watch full credit scene and find what happened to Lumi's granddad

Just finished the game!  I love this type of puzzle games, and the puzzles weren't too difficult that I would get stuck for ages and not be able to continue. Additionally, the hints themselves require a bit of math skills to figure out was another nice aspect (I did end up needing it a few times).  Both the music and graphics were great, and the range of puzzles made it really fun as well! I'm definitely glad I got this game (while it was on sale, so not as pricey as the full retail price is). Now I want to get the first game and play that as well! :D
Photorealistic adventure from fantasy environment that will please everybody. The puzzles are exacting and will keep your brain engaged!
Very cute and pretty game! Sadly with next to no story and easy/bad puzzles
Perfect Game!

Today I achieved playing and finishing Lumino City. It was a lot more linear than I expected - none of the classic back and forth of classic point-and-clicks - but it was charming, gorgeous (it's all handmade, mostly from paper) and surprisingly challenging at times. Was also surprised by the darkness and depth of the story.  Took about five hours all up so $20 is a bit steep, although it's currently 25% off in the Steam sale. Even if you hold off buying, definitely add it to your Wishlist.

I love this game so much that I find it an insult it's only rated 93%.  What can I say? It's one of those games that you can just sit back, relax and get lost in.  Gameplay: You're basically on a linear path to find your grandpa and there are tons of puzzles along that you need to solve to move forward. The puzzles have been implemented seamlessly into the story which gives you a very satisfying feeling when you complete a section. That said, some of the puzzles can be a little cryptic or just damn make no sense, luckily you have a handy little book that helps you along the way if you get stuck.  Music: Music is a huge part of this game. I'm not one of those people who pays too much attention to game music but when it's there I really appreciate it. Lumino City has some of the best music I've ever come across from any game. Not only is it pleasing to the ear, it matches the mood of whatever is going on in the game - sometimes even syncing to the games sound effects. Make sure to play this on a device that is capable of delivering good quality bass.  Art: The artwork looks like it's all been done by hand and painstakingly animated into the game. A lot of love and attention has clearly gone into creating the visuals and I have to say they've come out perfect. All in all It looks unlike any game I've seen before, a true work of art.  Conclusion; I recommend this game to anyone who likes a bit of puzzle solving. Five minutes in and you'll be hooked.  Something that I haven't seen mentioned a lot is the game's ability to recover from a crash. I'm not saying the game crashes a lot, because it doesn't (at least for me), but when it does crash, it brings you back to exactly where you were before. It basically constantly autosaves so you will never end up doing the same thing twice.  There is one thing that does bug me about the game though, I wish it gave you the option to choose the speed in which you read the dialogue. Although it gives you more than enough time to read before moving on, you end up missing some stuff because you may have been distracted for a second.  Please note that I've played this game for a lot more hours than it says up there. I played it before at a friend's house and nearly finished it so I decided to get it myself.

Great game! A handmade world out of paper to explore - I fell in love with this world instantly. Some puzzles are not that hard to solve, some are quite tough.. I came here by recommendation of Amanita Design and was rewarded with hours of fun - I can recommend this game to anyone who liked games like Machinarium and Botanicula.

Great improvement from previous Lume.  Lovely toy style, great music, good sound effect, small puzzles. Let me fully enjoy a few hours within the colourful cartoon city - Lumino City!  The product could be better if... 1) voice action on those characters 2) larger text (or no text presentation)
No replay ability but still a great game definitely a have to play.
This game is beautiful! It is so nicely put together, love the design!
Beautifully designed, delight, one of my best games ever.

In a world... where all of humanity has embraced Common Core Standards as way of life... we bring you 'Lumino City'.   It's a beautifully crafted world with some very challenging and abstract puzzles. The visuals really pull you into the game as does the music. Although it may seem cute for kids, it really is an older kid to adult game. The story is great, so far, and really keeps you wanting to move forward. Everything feels alive. I'm still playing.  There are some bugs when clicking on certain things. For instance, I had a baker get stuck in his window with no interactions available with him to continue the story. I had to just exit the scene and re-enter it. Fixed the problem. Continued as normal.  My only other gripe would be that it sometimes takes a bit of time running back and forth between puzzles and doing things. This would be because of the way the game is. You click and need to wait for the character to complete the action completely before being able to continue and click again. If you purchase this and get to the waterwheel, you'll see what I mean. It's a minor thing, but just a little annoying at times.  There is a great deal of satisfaction upon completing the puzzles and seeing/hearing the visuals come to life. The characters throughout the game are charming and memorable. It was definitely worth playing and experiencing what this game has to offer.

This game is artistically beautiful and fun to play. My only 'complaint' is that some of the puzzles are arcane and difficult to figure out what to do. Several times I had to resort to a walkthrough to help me understand and finish the puzzle. Otherwise, the game is one of the better puzzle games I've played.

One of the best puzzle games I've ever played! Such a beautiful story and the artwork is amazing. Handmade from paper and cardboards! The soundtrack is so calm and soothing aswell. I will probably play this game through again in a few months just because it was so epic. I got stuck on some places but eventually I figured it out. All in all it took around 6 hours to complete. LOVE IT!

I LOVE THIS GAME.  For anyone who digs puzzle/adventure game like I do, Lumino City is a must-buy. The art style is such a candy to the eye. The soothing music immediately draws you in. The fun puzzles provide enough challenges for your brain and some of them are so creative that they make you wanna beg for more. Also the handy manual is so cool and I actually would like to own a real book like that.   Wait, did I mention they actually build the whole Lumino City with paper? Yeah they did. Freaking awesome.

Absolutely beautiful game. lovely concept, great soundtrack. You can tell this game was made with a lot of love :) As an animation nerd who also appreciates a good brain teaser, I can't recommend this strongly enough. I was able to casually play through in a weekend and i was happy with where it left off, but certainly wouldn't complain if it had gone on longer.   Hope they are looking to make another one...fingers crossed!
The puzzles were pretty great, but what drove me through this game was the art style and the music! Absolutely reccommended.

Incredibly pretty game in which you attempt to find your grandfather.  Some of the puzzles are really nice and there's very minimal hand holding. It's definitely worth clicking around and exploring everything. Right at the beginning you are provided with a book that actually contains the solutions to all the puzzles in the game. I actually found this a really interesting way to do a hint system, although less hint-y than outright solve-y. Nevertheless it is an 800+ page book filled with vast quantities of stuff. Despite this it is still reasonably easy to find the puzzles you are looking for if you get stuck (or just don't fancy faffing around with a bunch of gears again) whilst at the same time solutions to puzzles you haven't reached yet don't really stand out and spoiler themselves due to all the other info in there.  There are some points where your character will move from one place to another in sequences that are beautiful to watch the first time and then just rather annoying when you misclick and have to watch them wander back and fourth just to return you to where you already were. There are also a few times where clicking the exact right spot to get your character to move/interact with something feels a little sticky and fair warning I did experience one crash however the game's save system meant I didn't lose any progress.  Overall though, the puzzles are beautifully done and mostly have some lovely ideas behind them, the story is charming and the art style is just incredible. It is relatively short (4-5 hours), which I think puts the price point rather high - I know I would have missed out on this had it not come up in a bundle and that would have been a shame. Although I normally have no problem saying a game is not worth picking up at full price, there is something about this one that makes me think that for a lot of people it probably will be.

This game is a nice simple relaxing game to play as a break from more intense gameplay. Some puzzles were too easy, but still enjoyable for their creativity. Other puzzles were really difficult to figure out but were rewarding when you stuck to it long enough to complete it without looking up the solution. A lot of the solutions are found in the journal you carry around with you, which felt like cheating to me, but it didn't seem like there was any other way to figure out what to do with some puzzles. This type of game is designed to be short, so it's hard to complain about the length, but I would definitely play more from this developer, for the creative design above all else.

First off, the 22 hours was because I left it running. I think the total time was around 5 hours of play.  I really enjoyed this game. I'm a big fan of point and click adventure games that tell a great story.  I did find the story a little lacking as it was more of go figure out how to get to the end to learn more. But overall, the puzzles and the complexity of them was just a perfect balance. Not too difficult, but almost all required you to think.  I did pick this up on sale. If it wasn't for that, I probably wouldn't have played it as I feel the current price is too high for an older game of this style.   But if you can get it on sale, certainly pick it up, well worth the play through.
Great game. Lots of fun puzzles. Hints are puzzles in themselves as well. About 4-5 hours of playtime.

This game is awesome for any puzzle lover.  The work made on this game is incredible, it's only paper craft, the story behind is just an excuse to bring you into a screen to screen puzzle game. The music is awesome and relaxing, every character is cute, even if they don't serve any other purpose than offer you puzzles to solve. There're no real social interactions in this town, everyone is on his own.  Some puzzles are really tough, but even the help is made in a very original way. Must have if you like little original gems.

I got the game during a Humble Bundle (for 1$)... I saw the video and I liked the graphics; they were pretty interesting for an indie game. I played it and then I LOVED it! Apart from the cute graphics, the game offers some exceptional puzzles, an intriguing story, its fair dose of suspense and a quite easy gameplay. It is the perfect game for those who never get bored thinking. Everything in it makes you work for your progress, from the puzzles to even the hint/solution book. Nothing is given away to you; you have to earn everything... That being said, I think that 20€ is a lot for an indie game. I would pay 5€, or in this case maybe even 10€, because of the great work put into it.

This game is short, yes, but it gives you so comfortable and cozy feelings, so much joy. Hand-made decorations are amazing, you can feel all hard work that developers made for this game.  If you like games like Machinarium, Samorost, Botanicula, then you absolutely should try this little gem. ^3^
Just finished Lumino City. It is a pretty, pretty game with a helpful guide if you really get stuck and inventive use of Lemons. No regrets here.

Very cute game that was obviously worked hard on but in some aspects, poorly executed. Lumino City looks beautiful, the OST is great to listen to, the puzzles are fun, but oftentimes I was getting tired of some long, slow animations and bugs more than I was having fun playing the game. Still would recommend - I got it for less than a dollar in the humble bundle, so it was worth that.
Very interesting game and very unique art style

Okay, so I definitely DO recommending this game, on certain conditions.  This game is fun, the puzzles are a good difficulty and you have the answers if you can't work them out (but they aren't too bad, really.)  Good gameplay length, and of course the visual aspect is amazing. What a huge undertaking to build the models and film them, then incorporate them into the game.  The story is simple, but cute, and there are some cool bits dropped in to create depth about the city.  So yes, I loved playing it, and if you like puzzle games/arty games, I think you will too.  HOWEVER, there are a couple bummers:  1. The price tag is not worth the game, IMO. I got it on sale so I can't complain, but I would never pay $20 for this game. I personally think $10 is the most it should retail for. That said, I completely understand that the time and effort it took to build this game was huge, and the devs and creators deserve to be compensated. But it's still too high a price for the experience.  2. The game is buggy. I had freezes happen several times, and I had to restart the game and click differently next time. Also this one time I approached a puzzle and it was already solved...so that was a bummer.  3. Its also annoying that Lumi had to get all the way to her destination before you could move again. Not that big a deal, but at times I wouldn't know where I was allowed to go so I would click all over, and it would take me wayyy back to where I didn't necessarily want to be, and I couldn't stop her or redirect. Again, not too big a deal, but it did irk me a bit.  Anyway, if you are rich and have the money, or if it is on sale, yes, get it, play this game.  P.S. Lumi is kind of a ♥♥♥♥♥...  8/10 -Would steal bicycle again

I thought the 'cheat book' was a very nice idea. Some puzzles are a bit abstract, and some parts are easily missed, I had to resort to online guides once after being stuck for 30 minutes. Otherwise I really love the stylistic choices, the look of this game is amazing, even though the camera is locked off most of the time, like any classic point-and-click.  If you like the look of the screenshots and enjoy puzzles/point-and-clicks I would recommend this game for you.
I loved this game. Was really cute. Puzzles were challenging. I really enjoyed this.
Neat graphics  9/10

Pros: The game looks beautiful. The fact that it was made by filming real paper construction gives it a distinctive look, and makes it look more real than a lot of CGI. The puzzles are fair. If you have to resort to a walkthrough, you won't be shaking your head, wondering how you were supposed to figure that out.  Cons: I said above that the puzzles are fair. But some of them are tough. At least, harder than I enjoyed. The in-game help system uses simple equations to give a page number in the manual that Lumi carries with her. For instance, 'Number of cogs x 100'; if there are three cogs in the puzzle that this refers to, the solution would be on page 300. But some of these clues are ambiguous: are you supposed to count the cogs that were already placed for you? Or just the ones you need to place yourself? And maybe it's not clear what constitutes a cog.  Bottom line: A fun puzzler with beautiful visuals.

Great game. Innovative and very artistic. Visually stunning, discreet sound, generally smart puzzles. Nearly perfect.  If I need to find a negative, I would say: why such a small font for the text? It was sometimes hard to read. But this is very secondary. This game is really great. I highly recommend.

Aside from some graphical glitches that require you reset the game to continue on occasion ( at least for me ) - Lumino City is just as magical, if not more so than the first. challenging puzzles; great music, and of course a cute story, i reccomend this title if youre even the slightest intertested in this after playing the first game.
This game is beautiful and so, so charming. If you love point-and-click puzzle games, this one should be on your list!

An all-around beautiful game with a very unique design. Almost feels like flipping through an art magazine with challenges on each page that must be completed before you can turn to the next page. 9/10

nice game, but i would only recommend buying it when it´s on sale. It will get you around 4/5 hours or gameplay so immo 20 euro is a bit on the expencive side for a short game. Other then that it is really nice

Lumino City is a game about playfulness and curiosity, which is most apparent in its stunning visuals — the game world was built in papercraft and photographed, akin to pre-rendered backgrounds in the Playstation era, — but the gameplay underlines it just as well.  The player controls Lumi, a little girl trying to find her grandpa, who got abducted to Lumino City. The game is a point-and-click, featuring only a little bit of, mostly environmental, storytelling, but makes up for that with a lot of puzzles. The puzzles are challenging. You are rarely told what you have to do and sometimes information, crucial to the understanding of the puzzle, is hidden somewhere else. There is a section where an old man teaches Lumi a guitar song. The player has to memorize the notes and play them from memory afterwards. If you make a mistake, the old man will repeat the part you flunked, but you have to play through the entire piece at once, without any guidelines, if you want to proceed. Parts like these make me feel like I'm taking seriously. I don't need a pop-up telling me what to do, if I take longer than ten seconds to solve a puzzle and I don't need someone telling me exactly, where to click or which button to press, at any given moment.  And in case you really don't get the puzzle, there is a pretty clever way to give you a hint. At the start of the game, Lumi acquires the Handymanual, a book filled with hundreds of pages of strange gadgets sketches. On the second page is an index of equations, corresponding to the games puzzles. The needed parameters can be found in the surrounding area or the puzzle itself. The solution of an equation is the page number, where the puzzles solution is noted. Of course, no one tells you how the Handymanual is used; you are told how to open it, no more. I don't want to go into a lot of puzzle examples here. Finding things out for yourself is the most delightful part of this game — And I can assure you, every puzzle in this game can be solved by logical reasoning and only little trial-and-error.  With Lumino City, State of Play delivered a game of 'Why not?'. Why not hide puzzle solutions in a book several hundred pages book? Why not grow potatoes on the top of your roof? Why not combine a lighthouse with a windmill? Why not attach small houses to the side of a cliff? Just trying something out is fun and Lumino City conveys this message pretty well. While the game is linear in its core, the player has to be curious, play with the given appliances and ultimately find the path for himself. In my opinion, this is exactly how a puzzle game should be like.  Read more of my reviews at:  theguygaming.com
Art is breathtaking! Loved the miniature handmade sets! Puzzles are good too (expect hard ones!).

Wonderful game! Graphics is like Blues Clues meets I Spy with a little bit of something else. Fun game play, will last a looooong time. If you get stuck, have no fear! Clues are hidden in the Handy Manuel you're given in the beginning! Gameplay is fun and easy in some parts and little bit more challenging in other parts, a good mix. 11/10 would recommend.

Lumino city is puzzle adventure game made of paper. You play as a young girl called Lumi. She tries to find her granddad in an city called 'Lumino city'. This game is really beautiful and also very unqiue thanks to the paper art & the music. I really can feel the love & the creativity which the creators put into this game. They did an amazing job on the puzzles aswell. Everything in the game makes this game so memorable.
The words are too small and they fades fast.  BUT! It's definitely a gooooooooood game!
